intro: Caccinia crassifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved caccinia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its large, broad leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
